summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll certifications and reports that list Genzman's name, position, and salary during the period from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents confirm his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The specific role Genzman played within the committee is not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), the congressional body tasked with reinvestigating the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in the provided documents, his presence on the HSCA payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's work during its investigation.
